alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:31PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lewis and Clark and south central Teton Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 630 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Augusta, or 21 miles southwest of Choteau, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and brief heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Augusta and Pishkun Reservoir. This includes Highway 287 between mile markers 38 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
